newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Rodionov candidate for UES post.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Rodionov candidate for UES post.

text.p: Russian Fuel and Energy Minister Pyotr Rodionov, who tendered his resignation last week, is a candidate for chairman of the board of national energy utility RAO UES, Rodionov told Reuters on Tuesday.
He said he was recommended for the post at the end of February by the government, which has a majority stake in the company.
"So far it is still the case," Rodionov said, commenting on the nomination. "But the government may now decide otherwise."
RAO Yedinaya Energeticheskaya Sistema Rossii (UES) president Anatoly Dyakov is also chairman of the board at present.
Rodionov's resignation as minister has not yet been accepted by Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin.
But Rodionov told Reuters he was leaving the ministry to work in business as he was not part of the team of new first deputy prime ministers, reformers Anatoly Chubais and Boris Nemtsov.
Rodionov, prior to becoming minister, was director of Lentransgaz gas transport subsidiary of natural gas monopoly RAO Gazprom.
Nemtsov has been charged with reforming natural monopolies, including UES, which he has criticised for a payments crisis but which he has promised not to break up.
